description: Primes p such that x^37 = 2 has a solution mod p.
comments: Complement of A059223 relative to A000040. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 14 2012
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: ok[p_]:= Reduce[Mod[x^37 - 2, p] == 0, x, Integers] =!= False; Select[Prime[Range[100]], ok] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 14 2012 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(300) | exists(t){x : x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^37 eq 2}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 14 2012(PARI)N=10^4;  default(primelimit,N);ok(p, r, k)={ return ( (p==r) || (Mod(r,p)^((p-1)/gcd(k,p-1))==1) ); }forprime(p=2,N, if (ok(p,2,37),print1(p,", ")));/* _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 21 2012 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
